required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of Stretching on Pain Sensitivity
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of a Stretching Protocol on Regional and Distant Pain Sensitivity:

collaborator.agency: Research Unit of General Practice, Aalborg

brief_summary.textblock:
The primary objective of this study is to determine the immediate efficiency of a six weeks regular stretching protocol on regional and distant pain sensitivity. It is hypothesised that regional and distant pain sensitivity will significantly decrease following six weeks of regular stretching.
The secondary objective of the study is to determine the effect after four-week cessation of the stretching protocol on regional and distant pain sensitivity. If regional and distant pain sensitivity decrease following regular stretching, it is hypothesised that the analgesic effect will abate following four-week cessation.

study_design_info.masking_description: Participants are blinded to the results of the pressure pain threshold measurements. Participants and examiner are blinded to the results of the range of motion and passive resistive torque measurements.

primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome is pain sensitivity expressed as regional and distant pressure pain thresholds measured by a handheld pressure algometer
The primary outcome is pain sensitivity expressed as regional and distant pressure pain thresholds measured by a handheld pressure algometer
The primary outcome is pain sensitivity expressed as regional and distant pressure pain thresholds measured by a handheld pressure algometer

secondary_outcome.description: Passive knee extension range of motion measured by the Biodex system 4 pro isokinetic dynamometer
Passive knee extension range of motion measured by the Biodex system 4 pro isokinetic dynamometer
Passive knee extension range of motion measured by the Biodex system 4 pro isokinetic dynamometer
Passive resistive torque measured in passive kne extension measured by the Biodex system 4 pro isokinetic dynamometer
Passive resistive torque measured in passive kne extension measured by the Biodex system 4 pro isokinetic dynamometer
Passive resistive torque measured in passive kne extension measured by the Biodex system 4 pro isokinetic dynamometer

other_outcome.description: Adherence to the stretching protocol will be measured using self-reported data from an mHealth app.

arm_group.description: Static stretching of the knee flexors

intervention.description: The intervention comprises of six weeks daily bi-lateral static stretching of the knee flexors. Stretches are performed seated on the ground. The participant sits upright on the floor with one leg straight. The sole of the other foot should be placed on the inside of the outstretched leg. The participant leans slightly forward, trying to touch their toes while maintaining full knee extension. Stretching is performed to the point of discomfort, and each stretch is held for 30-seconds for three repetitions.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy men and women aged 18-65 years are recruited. As part of the screening, volunteers will also be asked to indicate known medical issues or diseases. Participants are included if they have no known medical conditions such as
- cognitive impairments,
- neurological,
- orthopaedic,
- or neuromuscular problems that might affect the somatosensory system or preclude stretching exercises or range of motion testing at the knee.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Individuals who regularly engage in flexibility training (e.g., stretching, tai chi, pilates or yoga)
- or use any medication that might affect the somatosensory system, such as pain medication, are excluded.

overall_official.affiliation: Department of physiotherapy, University College of Northern Denmark

patient_data.ipd_description: Data is made available upon request.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: The study protocol will be published open access
